page.title: 05Wolverhampton: Falling Rolls
page.content: There has been a lot of public debate in the Wednesfield area over the past few months concerning the proposed plans of Wolverhampton Education Authority.Changes in the birth rate over recent years have led to a change in the areas population structure.There are now not enough secondary school age pupils to keep all the Comprehensive schools in the Wednesfield Area open without incurring financial penalties from the present government.The authority intends to close Wards Bridge High School and in future send pupils to other schools in the area. Many parents are unhappy about this reduction in choice in Secondary eduction and a campaign to keep the school open has been started.
